intro: Scurrula montana, commonly known as the mountain scurrilla, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe and western Asia. The plant features a branched stem and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the plant is often found in rocky or gravelly soils. Scurrula montana is typically perennial and has a low-growing habit, making it well adapted to its alpine environment.
